==Japanese==

===Etymology 1===
<div style="float:right;">
{{wikipedia|lang=ja}}
{{wikipedia|Asbestos}}
[[File:Asbestos_with_muscovite.jpg|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|石綿}} (''ishiwata'', ''sekimen''): a mineral sample showing naturally occurring '''[[asbestos]]''' fibers.]]
</div>
{{ja-kanjitab|いし|わた|yomi=kun}}
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=いしわた|石|tr1=ishi|t1=stone|綿|tr2=wata|t2=cotton, batting}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

The first appearance of this term is unknown.  The material was known in Japan at least as early as 1764, when {{w|Rangaku}} [[scholar]] {{w|Hiraga Gennai}} had asbestos cloth created based on Chinese techniques.  However, he called this cloth {{m|ja|火浣布|tr=kakanpu|lit=fire + wash + cloth}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|いしわた|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|いしわた}}

# [[asbestos]]

=====Usage notes=====
When used as a standalone noun, the ''ishiwata'' reading appears to be more common.

When used in compounds, the ''sekimen'' reading appears to be more common.

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|石綿瓦|いしわたがわら}}: an [[asbestos]] [[roof]] [[tile]], asbestos [[roofing]]
{{der-bottom}}

====Synonyms====
* {{ja-r|アスベスト}}
* {{qualifier|dated}} {{ja-r|石絨|せきじゅう}}
* {{qualifier|dated}} {{ja-r|温石棉|おんじゃくめん}}

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|せき|めん|yomi=on}}
May be a borrowing from {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=せきめん}} compound {{m|zh|石綿|tr=dzyek miɛn|lit=stone + wool, cotton}}.  Compare modern {{etyl|yue|-}} {{m|zh|石棉|tr=sek<sup>6</sup> min<sup>4</sup>}}.

Alternatively, may have been coined in Japan from {{etyl|ltc|-}}-derived elements as a compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=せきめん|石|tr1=seki|t1=stone|綿|tr2=men|t2=cotton, batting}}.
